thread.title_full: Athlete of the Week Reese Blackley--ALEXANDER

author: Neighbor Newspapers (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Athlete of the Week Reese Blackley--ALEXANDER
text: Alexander sophomore Reese Blackley specializes in putting points on the scoreboard for the Lady Cougars’ volleyball team.In 67 sets, the outside hitter Blackley has 267 kills and a kill percentage of 58.9 percent.“After [Sarah Smith] sets it, I have to think while I’m in the air which side is more open then I have to turn at the last second,” said Blackley of her routine before spiking a ball. “It’s just about where the other team is at and what I’m going to do to get the point.”Blackley also attributed much of her success to Smith, who is the main setter.“I can’t really hit the ball without passing and I have to have Sarah because without my setter and passers I can’t do anything,” Blackley said. “They really help me a lot.”Involved in volleyball since the age of 9, Blackley said she loves the sport and likes watching Kerri Walsh Jennings and Destiny Hooker play.“Kerri has just worked hard and she made it to the Olympics,” said Blackley, who is also a member of the West Georgia Volleyball Academy club team.“Reese was a First-Team All-Area player last year,” Alexander coach Adam Watts said. “She is a special player and has played club since she was 10 years old. A lot of the experiences she gets from club helps her grow every year. I foresee her being a First-Team player all four years of high school and playing in college also.”Blackley said being a member of a college volleyball team is definitely a goal and she has already received letters from a few programs.“I try to get the best out of everyone and get them to play at their highest potential,” said Blackley, who described herself as energetic. “I’m always really happy. I never get mad and I’m typically very cheerful.”As far as Alexander, the Lady Cougars are 22-9-1 at press time after earning a tough 9-21 record last season.“I think our coaching has really gotten better and we have been playing as a team,” Blackley said. “We’ve really worked together on calling for the ball and helping each other out.”Alexander concludes its regular season at Rockmart on Thursday and begins competition in the Area 5- tournament Oct. 10.“I really hope we can make it to state and get past the first round,” Blackley said.
